name: joviality
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality in a person of being friendly and in a good mood, or of a situation being enjoyable, friendly and pleasant: There was an air of joviality in the room. She had a forced joviality that made us suspicious. See
jovial
More examplesFewer examplesHe greeted them all with boundless joviality. I noticed her increased joviality."All right, all right, enough of the joviality," said Gregson.His joviality was dropped and replaced with irritability.
